tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE community_agroforestry_initiatives (
  project_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  project_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  project_description TEXT,
  project_location VARCHAR(100),
  project_start_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE initiative (
    initiative_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    initiative_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    community_id INT,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    total_volunteers INT
);

CREATE TABLE initiative (
id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
community_id INT NOT NULL,
start_date DATE,
end_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE community (
    community_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    community_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE tree_species (
    species_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    species_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    average_height FLOAT NOT NULL,
    canopy_coverage FLOAT NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE tree_planting (
    planting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    community_id INT NOT NULL,
    species_id INT NOT NULL,
    planting_date DATE NOT NULL,
    planting_location VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (community_id) REFERENCES community(community_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (species_id) REFERENCES tree_species(species_id)
);
CREATE TABLE volunteer (
    volunteer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    volunteer_email VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE volunteer_participation (
    participation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_id INT NOT NULL,
    planting_id INT NOT NULL,
    participation_date DATE NOT NULL,
    hours_spent INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES volunteer(volunteer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (planting_id) REFERENCES tree_planting(planting_id)
);
